parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: How much, how great, how many. From an absolute pos and hos; interrogative pronoun how much (plural) many).
Worse, more severe. Irregular comparative of kakos; from an obsolete equivalent cheres; more evil or aggravated.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To account or treat as worthy. From axios; to deem entitled or fit.
Punishment, penalty. From timoreo; vindication, i.e. a penalty.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and pateo; to trample down; figuratively, to reject with disdain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Probably from sun; common, i.e. shared by all or several, or profane.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From diatithemai; properly, a disposition, i.e. a contract.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From hagios; to make holy, i.e. purify or consecrate; to venerate.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To insult, outrage, treat contemptuously, mock at. From en and hubrizo; to insult.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Wind, breath, spirit.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
